name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Yosemite Gateway Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night, after leaving Yosemite N.P. I I had booked one of the family suites in advance, since that was all that was left to reserve. Since it was just my fiancee and I, we didn't need this big of a suite and I mentioned that at check in. I asked for a smaller room, but since none were available, since the hotel ws full. The check - in clerk actually took about $30 off the price of the room, to make it reasonably priced. I was psyched. This hotel is set up in a variety of buildings on the side of a mountain. The rooms were reasonably clean and there was plenty of parking. It looked like there were a lot of extras like a nice pool, exercise room and laundry facilities there, unfortunately we didn't have time to use any of them at all. There were multple restaurants within walking distance, we ended up going to the place next to the hotel If we were passing through here again, we would definately stay here. Only disappointment was that there was no continental breakfast...
reviews.title: Nice Place For Yosemite Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the gateway for 2 nights in september. The hotel is clean and the rooms are really spacious with a fridge, microwave, iron and good sized tv. Yosemite is about an hour away but there is a place called Bass Lake 8 miles away well worth a visit. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights on a tour of California, Utah.
reviews.title: Budget hotel, good sized family rooms

reviews.text: Great budget hotel, considering the price rooms where basic, but clean and spacious for the four of us with a fridge and small kitchen area and two separate bedroom/living areas. Rooms are located in separate blocks or about 8 units.
reviews.title: VERY nice hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We where located in a block at the top of the steep hill, which felt dark and a little isolated at night.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was easy to find, right off the main street through oakhurst. The lobby was beautiful and the building was kept up very nicely. The room was on the second level, and did overlook the main road. The walls were very soundproof though - we didn't hear any traffic or next door neighbors. The room was quite large with nice decor. The bathroom was big, and more importantly, very clean. There was a little area outside the bathroom that had a microwave, fridge, sink, and cupboards and a coffee maker. Free parking, down the stairs from the room. We had dinner at Todd's BBQ (down the main street on the left) which was AMAZING. Breakfast at Katie's Country Kitchen (down the main street to the right, two buildings, walkable), which was adequate.
reviews.title: Lovely Find for a Great Price!

likes.disliked: — Smelled like cleaner chemicals a little in the room

reviews.text: Overall the best western was a great stay! We would stay there again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: good hotel, clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good beds
reviews.title: Good stop-over for Yosemite NP

likes.disliked: — Nothing to complain, we were there in March and room rates were according. However if they will become higher during the season it can be annoying that breakfast is not included

reviews.text: clean
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay in Oakhurst

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a short (nice) drive to yosemite
reviews.title: Great location for visiting Yosemite

reviews.text: When we arrived they hotel had our reservation for the wrong day and the hotel was sold out. Without even asking the manager moved us to the house on the property at the same price.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now that's customer service. The rest of the staff at the hotel was very friendly.
reviews.title: A nice place at a good value

reviews.text: If you can't afford the pricey hotels and lodges inside Yosemite (or you don't make your reservations early enough), Oakhurst is probably the best place to stay outside the park (especially if you fly into Fresno). It is about 16 miles from the southern entrance to Yosemite, and about an hour's drive from Fresno. If at all possible, I suggest you stay inside Yosemite. The drive to the Valley or to Glacier Point is about 1 ½ hours each way of winding mountain roads that can be exhausting for the driver, as well as somewhat dangerous.
reviews.title: Comfy bed and great pool for our kid!

likes.disliked: — smell of cigarette smoke around pool and our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There not a lot of hotel accommodations in Oakhurst, but the Best Western is probably is the best choice for a clean, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel. We were tucked away in a quiet corner room with privacy and a balcony. The room was somewhat outdated, but well kept. There are two pools and a restaurant. We paid about $100 per night, including taxes. We spent two nights at the Best Western, then two nights at the Shilo Inn. The Shilo Inn is nicer, but about $30 more per night.
reviews.title: Next time I'll go somewhere else!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Oakhurst for a family graduation and got the recommendation to stay here from family in the area. We really liked the park like setting and outdoor shady swimming pool! Our room was large and adequate, the bed was comfortable and with a fridge in the room we were set for our toddler! While a non-smoking room, the staff were smoking outside our room and we did smell the stale stench in our room, especially when we ran the a/c or opened the sliding glass door. The multiple buildings allowed us to be at the same hotel as our family but not tripping over each other in the halls, some distance is nice! We saw the indoor pool but never used it, and also had high hopes of using the outdoor playground with our toddler but time ran out! While our room was over 130 a night it was a weekend and the hotel was full! We will stay here again when in the area!
reviews.title: Great place to stay near Yosemite

likes.liked: — The comfy bed, the idyllic surroundings and the location
likes.disliked: — Nothing, really -- I had no complaints

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: Room was very big & we had a rollaway in there. Tons of room in bathroom area - very large. Hotel was nice, very clean and would recommend. My only problem with the area is there's nothing to do in the evening. Once back from Yosemite, if you want to take a walk after dinner, really nowhere to go - no sidewalks - or town to walk around. Maybe everyone is so exhausted from the park they just sleep the night away...........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just did a one week stay in and around Yosemite. Oakhust was my first 2 nights stay. Oakhurst is a great little town with all the conveniences you will not have in the park. The Best Western was clean, comfortable (the wife loved the memory foam mattress) and very affordable. Parking is easy, and there are plenty of dining options in town. We had no need for any service so I can't rate that. Check-in was fast and easy. 50 minute drive to Glacier Pt or the Valley.
reviews.title: Great Price and Location
Good hotel overall
reviews.text: Stayed at the Best Western for 2 nights in July. We had a room in one of the older blocks, it was ok very dark and old fashioned but clean and the aircon was very decent . Also had a large fridge which was handy. It looks as though some of the blocks are much newer so try and ask for one of those rooms.

The hotel has a good outdoor pool, the indoor one is a bit grubby looking though. The hotel is a good base for visiting the park, it takes about 20mins to get to the park gate, then about another 30mins drive to get to the valley floor. Definately make the effort to drive up to glacier point, it takes quite a while but is well worth it for the view!
reviews.title: Scary front desk clerk and decor needs updating

reviews.text: We didn't eat at the resturant next to the hotel but we did get take out pizza from the pizza place next to the cinema which was good, there are also a KFC, Macdonalds, Subway, Starbucks etc and there are quite a few mediocre looking resturants. There are also 2 supermarkets which we found handy.
reviews.title: Another good review
Budget accommodation close to the park
reviews.text: A time warp!! The reception building and front of the complex looks very modern and shiny but if you are not in a room in that building, you step right back into the seventies. Our room was very dark (we needed the lights on all of the time) and smelly (we had asked for a non-smoking room but got saddled with a smoking room instead - they were fully booked so we couldn't change). The feeling of the whole room was that it was a little tired and needed a revamp.

The bed was comfortable but the headboard has a stupid design so that if you are sitting up reading and leaning against it, your head ends up being at a funny and painful angle. The towels that were provided were clearly old and rather scratchy and the toiletries were dispensed via a little machine in the shower area (we were glad to have brought our own).There was a laundromat in the complex which was good and the Velvet Rose/Sandrino restaurant provided a good value breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Yosemite Visit

reviews.text: Oakhurst itself was pretty interesting!! There are all of the main food chains there - Taco Bell, McDonalds, Subway etc but very few decent restaurants to eat in. We went out to eat once (to the Szechan place next door which was fairly good) but the alternate choices were so poor that we ended up with sandwiches for the other two evenings.
reviews.title: very good choice

reviews.text: Oakhurst is about 16 miles to the park and is well positioned for seeing the most accessible parts of the Park (Yosemite Valley and the Mariposa Grove). Yosemite Valley has the most stunning scenery that I have ever witnessed and the Mariposa Grove has some wonderful trails for exploring
reviews.title: Why the minature toilet?
Very good one
reviews.text: We slept in this hotel for a night early august 2006. The hall is very nice, with fountains and great decoration. Rooms are also very comfortable and clean. a good choice if you are visiting Yosemite Park and do not necessarily are interested in sleeping inside the park. I would definitely come back.

My wife, twin nine-year old boys, and myself trekked west from Illinois to take in Yosemitie National Park and its breathtaking views. We are not campers, but we wanted to be reasonably close to the Park. We settled on Oakhust, which is about 15 miles from the park entrance. However, the 15 miles is up a steep, winding road.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a town with lots of amenities

likes.disliked: — The steep, winding drive to Yosemite

reviews.text: We stayed here overnight while visitng Yosemite park. I was traveling with my husband and two girls (5 & 8). The hotel is located 40 minutes approx. from Yosemite's south entrance. The road to get there is very curvey and nauseating. The drive is worth it to go to see the sequoias.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced hotel.

reviews.text: As for the hotel, it is older, but clean. Worth the price we paid. We were on the second floor, and heard no noise from our neighbors. The room had comfy beds but the pillows could've been better. It was a nice experience.
reviews.title: No thrills

reviews.text: As for the restaurant, do not eat there. The hostess was rude and clueless. We stood in line on a Friday morning when the place was only barely occupied and waited what seemed forever. The hostess had no idea how to deal with customers. She would take an incoming group, seat them and serve them their coffees and such while the line just stared at her. She didn't seem to notice us waiting as other people were cashing out their bill, which she seemed to make them her priority.
reviews.title: Great Value at Yosemite gateway

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms, good pool area and value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service after we sat down wasn't much better. As I said, the place was practically empty but the staff moved at a snail's pace. It took 25 minutes to place an order and when our food finally came, it was cold. We didn't complain as we wanted to get on the road and we couldn't find our server anyway. The food was just blah and the only thing at our table that was even good was the pancakes. We did get a discount for being a hotel guest but it was still expensive. Lastly, the coffee was weak and terrible. We recommend going to a different breakfast location.
reviews.title: Well Rested

reviews.text: There aren't too many economical choices in the Yosemite area. This is one of the few lodging costing less than a hundred a night. I only stayed there for 1 night because I couldn't book something inside the Yosemite Park for that specific day. I think a day or 2 are fine but I won't want to stay longer.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

likes.disliked: — Would have preferred wireless internet and a continental breakfast to be included with room

reviews.title: Very clean, large room!
reviews.text: I always use Tripadvisor when booking a hotel and do my research. However, in this situation, we were in a car accident coming out of Yosemite and had no choice but to pick a hotel at random in Oakhurst and spend the night. I was very pleasantly surprised! The front desk clerk was pleasant and efficeint. We had 5 people and they had a family room available with 3 beds, a fridge and microwave for 95.00 per night with a free continental breakfast. The room was spotless and we were able to park right outside our room which was helpful since it was pouring rain. The breakfast was basic but the dining area was spacious and clean. They have both an indoor and outdoor pool, playgrounds for the kids and are in a parklike setting. This is a great hotel for families who do not want to stay inside Yosemite. Also, because of the accident, we had to interact with several businesses in Oakhurst. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We were defintely pleased with our stay.

I stayed at this hotel over new years eve and had a wonderful time. I will have to agree with others that the front desk staff aren't the helpfullest people, but I did experience some pretty good customer service during the day, so I believe the problem is just during the evening hours. The room was good sized, but lacking a microwave. We found everything very clean and in working order. The heater was a bit loud, but it was cold without it, so we survived. The indoor pool and hot tub were a life saver. It was very nice to be able to go and enjoy a dip in the pool and a soak in the hot tub after a day of wine tasting or tromping around in Yosemite. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great value for your dollar

likes.liked: — The surroundings. Very nicely decorated and it didn't feel like a stuffy hotel, very relaxing environment
likes.disliked: — nothing really. it was more the annoying guests in the pool playing keep away while we were trying to swim.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and comfortable and our room was big with a great bathroom. It was a bit of a trek to our room from reception, we only did it the once on our way back from dinner. There wasn't much to do in Oakhurst and all the restaurants seemed to close quite early, probably the time of year I suspect.
reviews.title: Nice Setting

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was a bit sparce, there was cream cheese with no bagels or toast.
reviews.title: Not as good as I'd hoped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set into a nice park surrounding, but you can't really help that in Yosemite! The room was of a large size, but the plumbing is quite noisy and the walls paper thin. I have one of the worst nights sleep on my vacation here.
reviews.title: Not too sure about this one!

aka: Best Western Plus Yosemite Gateway Hotel
description: Each of the 135 quiet and beautiful guest rooms have either deluxe queens, kings, or twin queen sized beds and there are 2-bedroom family units available for up to six people. Most rooms have a mountain view or garden setting and many have balconies and patios. Our hotel offers free High Speed Internet Access, In-room coffee, local calls Premium TV with HBO, CNN, ESPN standard for your enjoyment and comfort.
